channel.title: Mouse Detection
channel.description:
As most of us know, the client itself sends sends our mouse movements to the server. What most of us don't know, is how efficient this is. Many boast that they cannot record much activity because of the server space demands. WRONG.
In one week of constant playing and diligent activity inside of runescape you may, MAY at the VERY MOST add up to 2kb of data in the log. If 2000 people do this for one week then you would consume, at the very most, 3.91 mb. Now let's take into concideration that the average server has well over 450 gigabytes(RAID'ed of course) and the fact that runescape pulls in 76 million a year for jagex and its subsideries(from both advertisements and membership). Who here actually doubts that they can log you and all of your client data from now until... whenever?
So, just as a warning, I propose we all start working on new mouse functions. If you look at the mouse logging code, you will recognize the fact that Scar's is detected. It's about as hidden as a 300 lb 4'5" white American trying to be an assassin ninja. Not happening.

item.title: Mouse Detection
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Ben:

I don’t think they’ll ban you if your mouse position is the same position as the clicks,

What do you mean by that? The mouse usually has to be on top of something before you click it, lmao, which means that you’d be clicking the same position your mouse is.

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse Detection
item.dc:creator: @Ben Ben
item.description:
@Ben wrote:

I don’t think they’ll ban you if your mouse position is the same position as the clicks, seeing as there are those pads with pens people use as mouses.

Also there are touch screens out there, and all others mouse-like components for PC users.

Worth a try though.

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse Detection
item.dc:creator: @Iamadam Iamadam
item.description:
@Iamadam wrote:

[quote=“jake4d1, post:45, topic:1254”]what if you made a script that not only hovered over some stats and went off screen. but make it click certain stats at random.
also if you logged in 2 characters (one behind a proxy or something :p) you could them cycle thru predesigned conversations like
cartman: this is boring stan: quit complaining fatass cartman: SHUT UP! etc.
also you could make the game log out for about 20-30 min every few hours(make it look like your taking a piss or eating).

I know im just adding a bunch of ripped off ideas together but a script like that would be just about unbannable.

Sorry about my typing im really tired.[/quote]

It does sound un-bannable, but trust me, its as detecatble as…err/…thinks of something really detecatble…
Because Jagex monitors the way your mouse is moved, not only where it goes. They monitor things like speed, acceleration, idle time, curve, offset etc.
It would maybe reduce detection slightly, but in the end it would be wasted effort.
Good ideas though, its good to see you’re at least thinking

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse Detection
item.dc:creator: @thiefmn6092 thiefmn6092
item.description:
@thiefmn6092 wrote:

[quote=“pplsuqbawlz, post:25, topic:1254”]Good suggestion byte, at least you’re trying.

I may release something soon. I’m not sure though.

If I released a client and I logged all of your mouse movements, and while you played the game, would anyone volunteer to basicly be mouse-logged? If so, reply with a few features you’d like in a client so I might make it more fun for you guys. I’m just gonna collect all the mouse movements and use some advanced trigonometrics on it to make splines of your movements. That is, if I release anything on this topic, otherwise, I’m just not gonna worry about it.

Somethingtohide, you can’t credit card fraud, jagex bans your account for that… And all accounts used with it.[/quote]

I could use my l337 python skillz to write up an equation of some sort to kind of splinter mouse movements.

Read full topic
